FilterMenuPlugin.title: Filter Menu
FilterMenuPlugin.helpBody: This menu allows you to filter the objects displayed on the globe based on their type, orbital regime, and data source.

payloads.name: Payloads
payloads.tooltip: Objects that are primarily used to carry a payload, such as communication or weather satellites. This includes operational and defunct satellites.

rocketBodies.name: Rocket Bodies
rocketBodies.tooltip: The upper stages of rockets that have delivered payloads to orbit and are now large pieces of space debris.

debris.name: Debris
debris.tooltip: Fragments of spacecraft and rockets, including broken satellites, that are no longer one piece.

unknownType.name: Unknown Type
unknownType.tooltip: Objects in orbit whose purpose or type is not clearly identified yet.

notionalSatellites.name: Notional Satellites
notionalSatellites.tooltip: Satellites that are planned or proposed but not yet launched.

agencies.name: Agencies
agencies.tooltip: Planned feature - This will show agencies on the globe.

vleoSatellites.name: vLEO Satellites
vleoSatellites.tooltip: Very Low Earth Orbit satellites with an apogee below 400 km.

leoSatellites.name: LEO Satellites
leoSatellites.tooltip: Low Earth Orbit satellites with an apogee between 400 km and 6000 km.

heoSatellites.name: HEO Satellites
heoSatellites.tooltip: Highly Elliptical Orbit satellites with an eccentricity of 0.1 or greater and an apogee below 39786 km.

meoSatellites.name: MEO Satellites
meoSatellites.tooltip: Medium Earth Orbit satellites with an apogee between 6000 km and 34786 km.

geoSatellites.name: GEO Satellites
geoSatellites.tooltip: Geostationary Orbit satellites with an eccentricity below 0.1 and an apogee between 34786 km and 36786 km.

xgeoSatellites.name: xGEO Satellites
xgeoSatellites.tooltip: Ex-Geosynchronous Orbit satellites with an eccentricity below 0.1 and an apogee above 36786 km, or an eccentricity of 0.1 or greater and an apogee above 39786 km.

vimpelSatellites.name: Vimpel Satellites
vimpelSatellites.tooltip: Vimpel satellite catalog is maintained by the Russian joint-stock company JSC Vimpel, in cooperation with the Keldysh Institute of Applied Mathematics.

celestrakSatellites.name: Celestrak Satellites
celestrakSatellites.tooltip: Celestrak is a popular source for satellite orbital data, providing TLEs for a wide range of satellites and debris.
